page.title: 12Inchnadamph Lodge
page.content: {Assynt Estates}bought Inchnadamph lodge,paddock and all the high ground {(in 1973) from Mr.P.Wilson.}It was built after a design by{Thomas Telford as a Assynt Parish{manse}(now a shoot- lodge)in 1821.The original part of the house is still there with a pine wind- staircase typical of Telford.A moulded shield with the arms of the{Duchess {of Sutherland and the Marquis of {Stafford}is above the entrance. There is a circular drive and garden circled by alternate ash and sycamore planted by Sutherland Estates.In 1774,they had asked John Home to survey Assynt. He stayed at the old manse in Inchnadamph which was built by the minister{Rev. {William Mackenzie in 1771.}Records report 16 joists hauled by two horses each from Einig Wood in Oykel(32km). Wood was also found in Led_lanich moss by the River Loanan (now treeless).
